revised_title: Discovery of an Intracellular Toxin in the Typhoid Bacillus
tldr: The authors demonstrate the existence of an intracellular toxin within the typhoid bacillus by growing the organism on various culture fluids and disintegrating it at the temperature of liquid air. The resulting opalescent fluid, when inoculated into animals, proves toxic or fatal, confirming the presence of an intracellular toxin.
